programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: More high stakes cash action from Las Vegas. Bomb pots make their explosive Big Game debut, leaving one player fuming and in need of a reload. Meanwhile, Loose Cannon Jordan Handrich faces off against UK pro Sam Grafton in a hand worth $40,000.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: It's a high stakes cash game in Vegas with an amateur player competing against the pros. Tonight, Jordan the Loose Cannon goes for bomb pots, while Jennifer Tilly and Sam Grafton spar in multiple hands, with tens of thousands of dollars on the line.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: Hollywood star Jennifer Tilly continues to crush, as the penultimate session of this high stakes cash game begins. Meanwhile, time is running out for the Loose Cannon to bank a profit, and Gerard Piqué tries to recover some of his five-figure losses.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: More high stakes cash action from Las Vegas. Bomb pots make their explosive Big Game debut, leaving one player fuming and in need of a reload. Meanwhile, Loose Cannon Jordan Handrich faces off against UK pro Sam Grafton in a hand worth $40,000.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: It's a high stakes cash game in Vegas with an amateur player competing against the pros. Tonight, Jordan the Loose Cannon goes for bomb pots, while Jennifer Tilly and Sam Grafton spar in multiple hands, with tens of thousands of dollars on the line.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: Hollywood star Jennifer Tilly continues to crush, as the penultimate session of this high stakes cash game begins. Meanwhile, time is running out for the Loose Cannon to bank a profit, and Gerard Piqué tries to recover some of his five-figure losses.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra visits Durham, N.C. to meet with the biggest name in the sport of lacrosse: Duke attackman Brennan O'Neill. The No. 1 pick in the 2024 PLL Draft already has a Tewaaraton Award and an MVP of Team USA under his belt. This episode of THROUGH X will dive into his mindset and discover what's driving him in his final year on campus. Paul Carcaterra also visits South Bend, Indiana to learn from one of the best brother-duos in the history of lacrosse.

programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Brekstyn Schutten holds the lead in Event #4 over the final six players as $189,800 awaits the winner. Trailing Schutten are Chad Eveslage, Nick Petrangelo, Sam Soverel, Elio Fox, and Brock Wilson.

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.title: Being on Top
programme.desc: Four women, Sophia Simmons, Dylan Carter, Portia Fitzgerald and Bridgette Barlow, who at the height of their careers are leaders in their industry, discover that having it all is easier said than done. Faced with the challenge of wanting both a professional and a personal life, they realize that life at the top can at times be isolating, and require sacrificing the authority and control they've earned professionally.

He's still wanted for the murder of the Avery brothers, the sons of local tycoon Carl Avery (Barton MacLane). He's forced back into Rock Valley, however, because he's received word that outlaw Jack Cantrell (Ted de Corsia) plans on robbing a stagecoach that is coming into town. As Case struggles to earn the trust of the locals, he begins to suspect that Avery may have something to do with the planned robbery.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gets going on planting climbers for different aspects in his walled garden, recommending the best varieties to use for sun and shade. Carol Klein is at Glebe cottage taking inspiration from the nearby Devon hedgerows, and back at Longmeadow Monty begins replanting his jewel garden with perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As May gets under way at Longmeadow, Monty Don turns his attention to his `dry garden', an area where the soil is particularly thin and baked by the sun. He recommends plants which thrive in these conditions. Meanwhile, Rachel de Thame visits the gorgeous gardens of Coton Manor in Northamptonshire, where the owner has planted inspirational combinations in unpromising areas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes a special guest, the Duchess of Cornwall, to Longmeadow, where she shares her love of gardening. Nick Bailey visits Knoll Gardens and gives his tips on the tall perennials which give a burst of colour towards the end of the season.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explores some of Longmeadow's late-summer highlights and propagates a range of favourite plants for next summer and we meet an artist who has created a very special roof garden where creativity and colour collide.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don shows which plants to choose for sensational borders right through the summer - from ornamental grasses to late flowering perennials. He also plants out squashes and pumpkins, as well as making his own comfrey feed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage giving advice on the best hardy geraniums for different situations and sharing tips on how to lift, divide and propagate them.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This show celebrates the arrival of the holiday season. At Longmeadow, Monty ensures that there will be late summer colour by propagating some his favourites from the fantastically diverse salvia family. He also divides irises and reveals what has gone wrong with his onion crop. Joe finds seasonal inspiration at historic Newby Hall in North Yorkshire, home to the longest herbaceous borders in Europe.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Toby Buckland visits the RHS garden at Hyde Hall in Essex for ideas on creating and planting a dry garden, while Carol Klein shows her gardening students how to collect seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don unveils his plans for a wet meadow. He starts by planting herbaceous perennials that will thrive in heavy soils and also look good amidst the long grass. He also pots-on his salvia cuttings and explains the benefits of planting `green manure' in the veg patch. Now that he has harvested his potatoes, that is exactly what he is doing to boost the fertility of the soil for next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows what to do now to maximise next year's soft fruit crop by pruning his summer raspberries and planting on the strawberry runners he potted up a few weeks ago. As Monty harvests September's abundance in the vegetable garden he makes notes of the tastiest varieties he has grown this year which he would grow again next year, as well as sowing some quick growing crops to harvest in the autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty catches up with all his summer jobs in the border and the vegetable garden. Carol gets inspiration for planting combinations at Cothay Manor and Gardens, and Arit learns about slugs and snails.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don makes a start on his new wild flower garden at Longmeadow and at last gets to taste the first new potatoes of the year. He also demonstrates how a radical chop of some border plants now can rejuvenate them for later in the season. Carol Klein celebrates a cottage garden favourite, the foxglove, and Joe Swift drops in on world renowned garden designer, Dan Pearson.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the summer gathers pace and the weather starts to warm up, drought-tolerant plants really hit their stride. Monty Don shares some of his favourites from Longmeadow and garden designer, Adam Frost, shows us how to build a gravel garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on plants to use for foliage with tropical proportions, Arit Anderson continues investigating the use of peat and Carol Klein explores Oxford Botanic Garden's euphorbias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has got advice on taking cuttings from favourite roses to bulk up stock for free. He is also sowing in the vegetable garden now for a winter salad harvest right up until Christmas, and planning ahead and planting a beautiful display of narcissi and foxgloves to enjoy next spring and summer. Meanwhile, Carol Kelin is at Glebe Cottage collecting seeds from her favourite flowering perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1 of 3 Santee SS, a "compact" Shelby GT500, dune buggies, and a Morris Minor Traveler
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a Santee SS with an aluminum block Buick V-8 engine, one of only 3 ever made. Next, Tom is introduced to a "compact" Shelby GT500 along with a plethora of other interesting barn finds.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Renault R5 Turbo and Saab 900 Turbo
programme.desc: Early turbo cars! In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us the unique stories behind the Renault R5 Turbo, and the Saab 900 Turbo.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Unimogs, Mercedes 190E 2.3-16 and starting up a barn find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a long-time Mercedes mechanic and tours his collection of Unimogs and turbo diesel old Mercs. Next, Tom in is in the UK where he and a friend attempt to start a Morris Minor that hasn't run in over 20 years.

programme.title: MODIFIED - An Overland Porsche Cayenne and 2 Wild H1 Hummers
programme.desc: Matt goes behind the scenes at E-Motion Engineering and checks out how subtle but functional modifications can transform a Cayenne daily driver into a purpose-built escape mobile. Next, Matt jumps into 2 heavily modified H1 Hummers.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | AMG GT on Mercedes Secret Test Track, plus the new Porsche 911
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole heads to Mercedes' secret test track to drive and review the newest AMG GT. After that, Henry jumps in the new HYBRID Porsche 911 GTS (992.2) and wonders if the added weight will adversely affect the legendary nameplate.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Unique Porsche 911s
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of pair of unique Porsche's. First, it's the legendary Heigo 911 rally car. Next, Henry drives the incredible Ruf SCR that "technically" isn't a Porsche at all.

programme.title: No Perfect Formula
programme.desc: Cadillac Racing's historic return to the 2023 24 Hours of Le Mans.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Toyotas, BMWs, Nissans, Acuras and More!
programme.desc: This episode features THREE of Jason Cammisa's Ultimate Drag Race Replays. You'll see cars from BMW, Lexus, Toyota, VW, Hyundai and Acura.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | 3M-mile Volvo, Baja Bug racing, and 2 cars America never got
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a 3-million mile Volvo P1800, goes racing in a Baja Bug, and drives two interesting cars that were never offered for sale in America.

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Mercedes, Ferraris, and the BMW "Clown Shoe"
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drives a Mercedes 500SEC AMG, Ferrari F355, Ferrari 360, and a BMW M Coupe "Clown Shoe." Follow along as he makes the argument as to why these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tri-power Olds Super 88 and forgotten cars must GO!
programme.desc: Tom teams up with Davin Reckow, from our "Redline Rebuild" series, to unearth a large collection of forgotten classics, including an Oldsmobile Super 88 that gets a second lease on life after it's purchase and restored by a Barn Find Hunter viewer!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Gateway Bronco and Alfaholics Giulia Super R 270 Restomods
programme.desc: Henry drives and reviews Gateway Bronco’s latest and greatest version of its Ford Bronco restomod, the Luxe-GT.Next, Henry jumps in a much different restomod: Alfaholics' Giulia Super R 270.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find Story - Rare Ferrari and 427 Cobra Hidden for Decades
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a barn find motherlode! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies a rare Ferrari and a 427 Shelby Cobra that have been sitting for decades. This is the story of the find, removal, and auction of these amazing vehicles.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | Griot's Empire and Boo Boo's Garage
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours Griot's Garage which houses an amazing collection of vintage race cars. Next, Chris heads to Boo Boo's Garage where he finds and incredible collection of American classics.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | MST Mk1 Ford Escort and the Peugeot 205 GTI Tolman Edition
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews the MST Mk1: Motorsport Tools' Ford Escort Mk1 restomod.Next, Henry jumps in another restomod, this time from Tolman Motorsport.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa: Lucid Air, Ford Mach-E and Mustang GT
programme.desc: In this episode of ICONS, host Jason Cammisa talkes about why the Lucid Air is a time machine. Next, he directly compares the Ford Mach-E and the Mustang GT... and how they both stack up against the Tesla Model Y.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Classic Toyotas!
programme.desc: In this episode, watch as Chip Foose draws his creative take on the legendary Toyota FJ40 Land Cruiser.Next, Chip moves onto another Japanese classic from the same manufacturer, the iconic little sportscar: the Toyota MR2.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Larry Chen's R32 GT-R and Vin Anatra's BMW M3
programme.desc: Colin Comer welcomes Larry Chen and his R32 Nissan GT-R and offers his professional assessment of what it may be worth. Next, it's Hoonigan's Vin Anatra and his custom BMW M3 that goes under the microscope.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Cars

programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Bogotá, Colombia, to visit a world-famous Toyota Land Cruiser shop, The FJ Company. Next, Larry reveals the magic behind Garage Yoshida, the world's leading Nissan GT-R restoration shop.

programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss and Captain James Hillman are heading out of Highland Park Fish Camp in Deland, Florida, looking for largemouth bass.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes to the magical Island nation of Malta to explore the secrets buried beneath the waters.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons goes to the magical Island nation of Malta to explore the secrets buried beneath the waters.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The Rat Shack has been destroyed so Dustin and Cody try to figure out a way to take out Splinter while Randy is trying to get last minute projects wrapped up before the first deer camp of the season.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project - "Managing Your Herd"
programme.desc: Randy talks about herd management and what it takes to get and hold mature whitetails on the Raven.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: The bite’s dead during a neap tide, but Josh and Isaiah don’t back down. Watch them adapt, pivot, and turn a tough day into a hard-earned win. It’s not luck—it’s hustle.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex explore the SS United States; the world‘s largest artificial reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick joins Capt. Dave DeGenarro as lightning quick bonito invade New Jersey waters for fast-paced, reel-burning action on light tackle.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys to kick off the new season. Ali gets to check out Rush's new digs at the Ocean's Edge Resort and take a ride on the new, Mercury powered SeaVee 34Oz. Rush has been dialing in his new live bait set up and has a few freshies to hopefully feed to a hungry wahoo. And if that doesn't work, there's always something great to catch in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Everglades City Florida to meet up with local Capt. Jimmy Wheeler of the Everglades Fishing Company to get a taste of what the saying "Old Florida" really means. With the SeaVee 270Z bay boat in tow, the guys look to Jimmy to put them on the bite, fishing the shallow inshore wrecks and rock piles for Snook, Grouper, and Cobia.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Merritt Island, the sleepy space coast town where Ali was first introduced to fishing in Florida. Hoping to partake in a specialized fishery termed "fishing the other side," the guys will need calm weather, a serious boat, and a capable crew if they are going to have a shot at the yellowfin tuna that cruise the edge of the gulf stream current 100 plus miles off the coast.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: In a move to scratch one off the destination bucket list, Ali and Rush reunite with old friend Juan Spragge at the Toucan Lodge in Panama's Gulf Of Chiriqui. With close access to Hannibal bank and the islands of Montuosa and Coiba, the guys target mahi, marlin and tuna while enjoying the secluded comfort and hospitality of this unique family run lodge

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Panama adventure continues as Ali and Rush switch their focus to the inshore possibilities at the Tucan Lodge in the Gulf Of Chiriqui. With numerous islands, pinnacles, and structures to work live baits and lures, the guys target species such as rooster fish, mullet snapper, and the king of the bottom... the Cubera Snapper.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run west from Hawks Cay to fish the spring tarpon migration at the legendary Bahia Honda bridge.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head down to Key West to join Captain Brandon Cyr for some skinny water bonefishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor fish the Lower Keys with Captain Brandon Cyr for baby tarpon in the mangroves.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell fishing out of Hawks Cay for some grouper and tarpon action in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Sergeant Major (r) Jamey Caldwell brings some game changing technology along as he joins Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor for some nighttime tarpon fishing at the Long Key Bridge.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: Our final show highlights some of the best diving of the year.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on the iconic St. Johns River. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: What is Southern Culture on the Fly? Jay links up with the founders of this grassroots angling staple - SCOF Magazine.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Watch along as Jay learns to clean fish from ‪@reedthefishmonger‬. Watch the full video and learn to clean any fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at the seine net to catch some shrimp. Then meets up with Chef Dave to cook up some amazing Shrimp and Grits. After, Travel to Jekyll Island for the Shrimp and Grits Festival.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John meets with the experts at Marine Surplus to select proper fiberglass materials for his classic 200 Aquasport project, then back at SSTV HQ, John and Bert tackle raising the transom to 25”.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John and Bert work to gut and re-foam the stingers in the classic 200 Aquasport project. John visits the experts at Marine Surplus to search for a new center console. Finally, we learn about new carpeting options on the classic Glastron project and get expert marine hardware tips.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are smacking turkeys and making mid-term investments. 1031 Tax money is the number one way to build your land portfolio and create a place for your family to enjoy. Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.desc: Three friends finally pack their bags and head west for the annual HuntStand pronghorn hunting camp—each with a unique goal in mind.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Notoriously nocturnal and living in some of the densest cover imaginable, the black-tailed deer is generally known to be more ghostly than the most challenging old whitetails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Texas isn’t all mesquite flats, corn feeders, and wire fences. Some of the most extreme terrain in the country can be found in the Lone Star State, and it just so happens that hunting opportunities abound for the adventurous.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.desc: Mike heads to Crystal river to chase Redfish in his new Cayo Skiff.

programme.desc: Randy is at the Raven in Missouri trying to take advantage of some dry weather and get some Big Tine borderline planted and check off a long list of other summer time prep work as opening day of deer season will be here before we know it.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The Rat Shack has been destroyed so Dustin and Cody try to figure out a way to take out Splinter while Randy is trying to get last minute projects wrapped up before the first deer camp of the season.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project - "Managing Your Herd"
programme.desc: Randy talks about herd management and what it takes to get and hold mature whitetails on the Raven.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: The bite’s dead during a neap tide, but Josh and Isaiah don’t back down. Watch them adapt, pivot, and turn a tough day into a hard-earned win. It’s not luck—it’s hustle.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and Alex explore the SS United States; the world‘s largest artificial reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick joins Capt. Dave DeGenarro as lightning quick bonito invade New Jersey waters for fast-paced, reel-burning action on light tackle.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys to kick off the new season. Ali gets to check out Rush's new digs at the Ocean's Edge Resort and take a ride on the new, Mercury powered SeaVee 34Oz. Rush has been dialing in his new live bait set up and has a few freshies to hopefully feed to a hungry wahoo. And if that doesn't work, there's always something great to catch in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Everglades City Florida to meet up with local Capt. Jimmy Wheeler of the Everglades Fishing Company to get a taste of what the saying "Old Florida" really means. With the SeaVee 270Z bay boat in tow, the guys look to Jimmy to put them on the bite, fishing the shallow inshore wrecks and rock piles for Snook, Grouper, and Cobia.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to Merritt Island, the sleepy space coast town where Ali was first introduced to fishing in Florida. Hoping to partake in a specialized fishery termed "fishing the other side," the guys will need calm weather, a serious boat, and a capable crew if they are going to have a shot at the yellowfin tuna that cruise the edge of the gulf stream current 100 plus miles off the coast.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: In a move to scratch one off the destination bucket list, Ali and Rush reunite with old friend Juan Spragge at the Toucan Lodge in Panama's Gulf Of Chiriqui. With close access to Hannibal bank and the islands of Montuosa and Coiba, the guys target mahi, marlin and tuna while enjoying the secluded comfort and hospitality of this unique family run lodge

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Panama adventure continues as Ali and Rush switch their focus to the inshore possibilities at the Tucan Lodge in the Gulf Of Chiriqui. With numerous islands, pinnacles, and structures to work live baits and lures, the guys target species such as rooster fish, mullet snapper, and the king of the bottom... the Cubera Snapper.

There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew leaves the bayous and heads down river to Venice, Louisiana where they prepare for their first duck hunt in the delta.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna celebrate the first day of summer by taking their daughters out for a fun-filled day on the water.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: From time to time you have moments that will change the way think about something. That is what happened for us while hunting the Scimitar Oryx with Republic Outdoors. Hunting is more than harvesting animals, it’s conservation, and in this story, we learn how a species nearly extinct gets another chance to live.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John meets with the experts at Marine Surplus to select proper fiberglass materials for his classic 200 Aquasport project, then back at SSTV HQ, John and Bert tackle raising the transom to 25”.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John and Bert work to gut and re-foam the stingers in the classic 200 Aquasport project. John visits the experts at Marine Surplus to search for a new center console. Finally, we learn about new carpeting options on the classic Glastron project and get expert marine hardware tips.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are smacking turkeys and making mid-term investments. 1031 Tax money is the number one way to build your land portfolio and create a place for your family to enjoy. Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from what’s not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.desc: Andrew explores iconic foods of Paris, from croissants to macarons.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods: Delicious Destinations

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion

programme.desc: Mischievous grandma Madea lands in jail, where she meets a variety of mixed-up characters.

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion
programme.desc: Everyone’s favorite feisty grandma attempts to hold a family reunion while running a wedding and a funeral all in the same hilarious weekend.

programme.title: Dirty Grandpa
programme.desc: A week before his nuptials to a bridezilla, an uptight lawyer gets kidnapped by his potty mouth grandpa for a spring break road trip to Daytona Beach.

programme.title: Friends with Kids

programme.title: How to Be a Latin Lover

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion
programme.desc: Everyone’s favorite feisty grandma attempts to hold a family reunion while running a wedding and a funeral all in the same hilarious weekend.

programme.title: The Killing Fields
programme.desc: The haunting true story of a Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter and his translator, trapped amidst the brutal horrors of Cambodia's Khmer Rouge regime.

programme.title: A Scanner Darkly

programme.title: Guilty by Suspicion

programme.title: Overnight Delivery
programme.desc: After mistakenly sending an angry letter to his girlfriend, a college student gets help from a stripper as he races against time to stop the delivery.

programme.title: The Majestic
programme.desc: Upon getting into a car accident, a Hollywood screenwriter develops amnesia and ends up in a small town, where he is mistaken for a missing war hero.

programme.title: Revolution
programme.desc: In 1776, a fur trapper reluctantly takes up arms to fight for freedom when his son is imprisoned during the violent struggle against the British.

programme.title: Chaos Theory
